Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2018 08:41PM Mama1416 wrote: I had really long curly hair before treatment. I had my neighbor give me a cute short haircut. Then one week after starting A/C chemo I decided to shave it. We had a "shaving party" mostly because I wanted my kids to know I wasn't afraid to lose my hair. They were 14 and 16 at the time. They both participated in giving me a buzz cut before my cousin finished the job. Your scalp may tingle or feel sore as you start to lose the hair so don't let that frighten you. My eyebrows thinned out, but did not completely fall out. I lost my body hair, eyelashes and nose hair. Everything slowly started to grow in during my Taxol treatments. My eyelashes grew in and fell out for a few growth cycles. My hair grew back very thick and curly just like before treatment. Hang in there. It really feels like a marathon. You will look back and feel amazed at how you persevered
